summary: 'Endgame' Directors Share Photo Of The Original Six Avengers With Tom Hiddleston's Loki
title: 'Endgame' Directors Share Photo Of The Original Six Avengers With Tom Hiddleston's Loki
excerpt: 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Anthony and Joe Russo reveal a behind-the-scenes photo of the original 6 members with Tom Hiddleston as Loki.
description:
Avengers: Endgame found the surviving members of Earth’s Mightiest Heroes and their new allies utilizing time travel as a means to reverse the decimation that Thanos (Josh Brolin) brought to the entire universe. Part of that journey included a stop back in 2012 where the Battle of New York occurred in which Loki (Tom Hiddleston) brought the Chitauri army to attack.

Avengers: Endgame directors Anthony and Joe Russo shared a brand new set photo giving fans a behind-the-scenes look at the original six Avengers and Tom Hiddleston as Loki as seen in the film. The returning cast members had to don their original outfits from the 2012 film directed by Joss Whedon in order to recreate the events of the Battle of New York in which Tony Stark (Robert Downey Jr.), Steve Rogers (Chris Evans), Bruce Banner (Mark Ruffalo) and Scott Lang (Paul Rudd) had to travel to.

You can check out the new photo of the Russo Brothers, the original six Avengers and Tom Hiddleston as Loki down below:

Despite his fate in Avengers: Infinity War, Tom Hiddleston is set to reprise his role as Loki in an upcoming Disney+ series that is currently in development. Given 2012 Loki’s escape with the Tesseract in Avengers: Endgame, perhaps that was set-up for what that series is going to be.

What do you think of this image? What did you make of the plot decision to travel back to the 2012 Battle of New York with the original Avengers and Tom Hiddleston as Loki? Sound off in the comments below, and be sure to continue following Heroic Hollywood for all the latest news in the MCU.

summary: Endgame BTS Photo Assembles the Original Avengers (Plus Loki)
title: Endgame BTS Photo Assembles the Original Avengers (Plus Loki)
excerpt: In a new behind-the-scenes photo from Avengers: Endgame, the case of 2012's The Avengers reassembles one final time.
description:
In a new behind the scenes photo, the directors of Avengers: Endgame, provided a nostalgic look at the core team of heroes that launched the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Joe and Anthony Russo appear one on each end of the posed group shot, with the actors who played the six original Avengers between them in the costumes they wore in 2012’s The Avengers. Also given a place of honor is Tom Hiddleston, who plays Loki, the occasionally heroic figure who was the team’s first major villain.

The picture was apparently taken while shooting a scene from Endgame which recreates the climax of 2012’s Avengers as  some characters travel back in time.

All of the actors are in costumes identical to the ones they wore in the earlier film, with the exception of Mark Ruffalo, who’s dressed in a suit designed for the motion capture required for him to play the computer-generated Hulk.

The only comment accompanying the image is “The OG’s…”, meaning “Original Gangsters” or the “Original Gang.”  Since the arcs of several of the characters was finished in Endgame, it’s likely that this photo will be one of the last taken on set of all of them together for the foreseeable future.

Woke: None of that really happened. Everybody occupies a...
body:
Broke: Tony and Tasha died in Endgame. Steve went back to the 40s.

Woke: None of that really happened. Everybody occupies a personalized floor at Stark Tower. Friday’s pizza night.

summary: “Just know w’re always here for you. No matter what happens.” Hope promised. She had always been like a big sister to you and...
caption:
“Just know w’re always here for you. No matter what happens.” Hope promised. She had always been like a big sister to you and you couldn’t be more grateful.

Scott grinned, “What she said. You ready to grab something to eat?”

You laughed, “I love you both.”

Requested By Anonymous

summary: meanwhile back in 40s brooklyn
body:
meanwhile back in 40s brooklyn

pre serum steve, barely standing: i am NOT. FUCKING. DRUNK.

bucky: can you tell the time?

pre serum steve, turning and pointing aggressively at the nearest clock: i am NOT. FUCKING. DRUNK.

summary: Beginning of the End
title: Beginning of the End
body:
Ya know, I remember watching Iron Man in theaters in Jr. High. Dad was  HUGE comic books fan as a kid, I knew mostly DC from growing up on Batman: the animated series but I knew enough about Marvel and Stan Lee to enjoy. It was such a THRILLING experience, watching an actor I knew but didn’t know playing this seemingly assholish character that you couldn’t help but love on the screen and I just MELTED.

Iron Man, Tony Stark, held a soft spot in my heart because of it. Even as new movies came out, each better in graphics than the last, the budgets bigger, the actors more prepared, the fans swarming to give them love and appreciation, Tony Stark remained my favorite through it all.

I knew the act of being a different person before other people. I knew how it felt to be perceived as stuck up or an asshole. I knew how it felt to have friends betray you. I knew how it felt to feel so close to losing those you love. I knew how scary it felt to want to open yourself up, in fear of betrayal or lost.

When I went to watch End Game, I went alone because my parents were working and I had time. I was floored. I cried so many times, I laughed almost as much, and I felt the closing of an era to step into a new one. And when I walked out of the theater, I realized something.

It was the exact same theater room I watched Iron Man in.

I don’t know if it was poetic justice, coincidence, or some kind of meant to be thing but it only made it all more real. This was the end. An end of the line for me as I approach the daunting task of leaving my home, my friends, my family for the first time. For leaving behind a childhood carved with struggles, depression, anxiety, fear, love, hopes, dreams, and so many loses.

And here I am about to leave my own Iron Dad.

He’ll always tell me that he’s more like the Hulk (never says Bruce Banner) due to his savagery in fighting and need to smash things in his path, but I know he’s more like Iron Man. Yeah my dad used to fight a lot, more than I’ll ever know or ever care to know, but he’s so soft and gentle and kind. He puts up a front in front of others because he was treated like the outsider, like a monster, so he played the part and played it well until my mom came. Then my sister. Then me. And now he has my beautiful little niece who he absolutely loves.

And he’s so SMART. He never realizes how damn smart he is. And he’s cocky as all hell, loves his rock too, and he has a problem with authority even though he IS the authority. I’m not explaining it all well and it’s 2:28AM when I write this, but he’s so much like Tony and I think that’s why it hurt so much to watch Tony die.

And gods, my mom is so like Pepper. Smart as all hell, deadly when she wants to be, and a fighter to boot. She helped my dad see the man he could be, see that he didn’t need to put up a front around her, he never needed to. I know when they go to watch End Game, my mom is going to be crying and my dad will be trying not to, because I think they’ll know too.

I’m not entirely sure why I’m writing this, other than I’ve been super emotional and my anxiety is running rampant and my hormones are off kilter, but I needed to write this.

Love you all <3 and thanks, if you are, for reading my rambling

She helped my dad see the man he could be, see that he didn’t need to put up a front around her, he never needed to. I know when they go to watch End Game, my mom is going to be crying and my dad will be trying not to, because I think they’ll know too.

I’m not entirely sure why I’m writing this, other than I’ve been super emotional and my anxiety is running rampant and my hormones are off kilter, but I needed to write this.

Love you all <3 and thanks, if you are, for reading my rambling
trail.content:
Ya know, I remember watching Iron Man in theaters in Jr. High. Dad was  HUGE comic books fan as a kid, I knew mostly DC from growing up on Batman: the animated series but I knew enough about Marvel and Stan Lee to enjoy. It was such a THRILLING experience, watching an actor I knew but didn’t know playing this seemingly assholish character that you couldn’t help but love on the screen and I just MELTED.

Iron Man, Tony Stark, held a soft spot in my heart because of it. Even as new movies came out, each better in graphics than the last, the budgets bigger, the actors more prepared, the fans swarming to give them love and appreciation, Tony Stark remained my favorite through it all.

I knew the act of being a different person before other people. I knew how it felt to be perceived as stuck up or an asshole. I knew how it felt to have friends betray you. I knew how it felt to feel so close to losing those you love. I knew how scary it felt to want to open yourself up, in fear of betrayal or lost.

When I went to watch End Game, I went alone because my parents were working and I had time. I was floored. I cried so many times, I laughed almost as much, and I felt the closing of an era to step into a new one. And when I walked out of the theater, I realized something.

It was the exact same theater room I watched Iron Man in.

I don’t know if it was poetic justice, coincidence, or some kind of meant to be thing but it only made it all more real. This was the end. An end of the line for me as I approach the daunting task of leaving my home, my friends, my family for the first time. For leaving behind a childhood carved with struggles, depression, anxiety, fear, love, hopes, dreams, and so many loses.

And here I am about to leave my own Iron Dad.

He’ll always tell me that he’s more like the Hulk (never says Bruce Banner) due to his savagery in fighting and need to smash things in his path, but I know he’s more like Iron Man. Yeah my dad used to fight a lot, more than I’ll ever know or ever care to know, but he’s so soft and gentle and kind. He puts up a front in front of others because he was treated like the outsider, like a monster, so he played the part and played it well until my mom came. Then my sister. Then me. And now he has my beautiful little niece who he absolutely loves.

And he’s so SMART. He never realizes how damn smart he is. And he’s cocky as all hell, loves his rock too, and he has a problem with authority even though he IS the authority. I’m not explaining it all well and it’s 2:28AM when I write this, but he’s so much like Tony and I think that’s why it hurt so much to watch Tony die.

And gods, my mom is so like Pepper. Smart as all hell, deadly when she wants to be, and a fighter to boot. She helped my dad see the man he could be, see that he didn’t need to put up a front around her, he never needed to. I know when they go to watch End Game, my mom is going to be crying and my dad will be trying not to, because I think they’ll know too.

I’m not entirely sure why I’m writing this, other than I’ve been super emotional and my anxiety is running rampant and my hormones are off kilter, but I needed to write this.

Love you all <3 and thanks, if you are, for reading my rambling
trail.content_abstract: Ya know, I remember watching Iron Man in theaters in Jr. High. Dad was  HUGE comic books fan as a kid, I knew mostly DC from growing up on Batman: the animated series but I knew enough about Marvel and Stan Lee to enjoy. It was such a THRILLING experience, watching an actor I knew but didn’t know playing this seemingly assholish character that you couldn’t help but love on the screen and I just MELTED.

tags: DON'T YOU DARE STEAL MY IDEAS DISNEY
summary: The other day I finally watched Captain America: Winter Soldier, one of the few MCU movies I didn’t watch before going to see...
body:
The other day I finally watched Captain America: Winter Soldier, one of the few MCU movies I didn’t watch before going to see Avengers: Endgame and I gotta say… It should totes be called “Natasha Romanoff: Badass Spy”, because really… Steve Rogers is a door, Romanoff does everything… why do people worship Cap so much? He’s boring… I bet it’s just the pecks… if we had Chris Evans play Romanoff and Scarlett Johansson play Rogers everyone would be saying she’s the best and not paying attention to him…
That’s why as a screenwriter/director I wanna do an Avengers reboot where everyone is played by Scarlett Johansson… and then one where everyone is played by Natasha Romanoff played by Scarlett Johansson… like… Romanoff does impressions of her pals…
God grief that the internet is here to prove I had this idea first if Disney tries to steal it from me without inviting me to direct that… <>.<>

tags: The more I watch the scenes of them
the more it shows that she's more of a parent to him than he is to her
so why is she the one who is treated like a child?
Cause that's actually REALLY messed up.
summary: I know I’ve made a post about this before, but it’s still bothers me so here it comes again! I saw a lovely gifset of the...
body:
I know I’ve made a post about this before, but it’s still bothers me so here it comes again!

I saw a lovely gifset of the moments between Nebula and Tony’s time together on the ship but then I saw some comments and cringed.

I’m sorry but it still annoys me that people are calling her his “child” or calling him her “dad”. Like the gifset where people said this literally shows her stitching up his wound, as well as her insisting he finish off the last of their food. That is not the relationship between a father-daughter, or even one where he’s looking after her. It is an equal and balanced relationship between FRIENDS working together to survive!

I know people have their headcanons and each their own, but I really hate seeing people call Nebula “Tony’s daughter”. It’s so undermining of their actual relationship (as well as Nebula’s character) and makes them seem like there is an unbalance between them when it’s actually the opposite.

In fact, the more I think about it, it’s really bad that the only “dad” thing Tony actually does with her is introduce her to play a paper game. Other than that SHE’S shown looking after HIM (that is, when they’re not working together). And it’s actually kind of messed up that people ignore this and infantalize Nebula for the sake of adding another “child” to Tony’s family.

blog.name: tonystarkfandom3000
blog.title: Tony:MyHero3000
blog.description: So, if you like Tony Stark like I do, chances are you got traumatized by Endgame. This is a blog dedicated solely to him. Basically, a memorial because no one can possibly be allowed to forget him and because we all need therapy... Submissions and asks and whatever are always open. Target: REMEMBER Tony Stark a ridiculous much every day. Follow for more!

summary:
Look St*rkers, you little pieces of shit, stop ruining it! 
Seriously, I used to believe that I would totally respect various...
body:
Look St*rkers, you little pieces of shit, stop ruining it!

Seriously, I used to believe that I would totally respect various fandom opinions and ships in spite of how I feel about them. Usually, I do. But this… This abomination you’ve conjured up for us. NO WAY

So, yeah, I’m sorry but seriously screw off.
